text: can anyone share an example of how I would set the defaults for a custom module on a specific page layout?
So to be clear, they can duplicate the module (and it stays in the theme folder?)

It will not stay in the theme folder because the folder is read only. If you need significant changes we recommend cloning the whole theme. 

Also remember when customizing a theme you can use non-theme modules in the pages using a theme.

<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/modules/using-modules-in-templates|https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/modules/using-modules-in-templates> the same parameters based on field name that you would use for a module added another way.

<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/tags/dnd-areas#drag-and-drop-module-code-dnd-module-code-|https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/tags/dnd-areas#drag-and-drop-module-code-dnd-module-code->

So if module.html is in the module then 

Module attribute = html?

No. So the defaults you are setting are the field defaults. The modules fields you use the field name(not the field label) as the parameter name. Based on the field type you provide the type of data your module field is expecting. Examples of module field parameter expected data format is in the bottom of using modules in templates page.

 If text it simply looks like `my_module_field="my text here".`
